final_answer:
The image is funny or satirical due to the contrasting emotions and scenarios depicted. On the left, a person with an antenna is causing annoyance to an angrily frowning face. This suggests irritation caused by technological signals, perhaps representing how technology or connectivity can be bothersome.

On the right, a person in a car is depicted as happy with music notes surrounding them, enjoying music while driving. This juxtaposition highlights the humor in how annoyance from technology in one context (e.g., signal interference or noise) is contrasted with enjoyment in another (listening to music in a car).

The satirical element stems from the exaggerated reactions to these modern experiences, poking fun at how technology can simultaneously be a source of both annoyance and pleasure.
